content.question:
Post ipsum auxilio subeuntem ac tela ferentem

corripiunt, spirisque ligant ingentibus; et iam

bis medium amplexi, bis collo squamea circum

terga dati superant capite et cervicibus altis.

(5) llle simul manibus tendit divellere nodos,

perfusus sanie vittas atroque veneno,

clamores simul horrendos ad sidera tollit:

qualis mugitus, fugit cum saucius aram

taurus et incertam excussit cervice securim.

In the passage above, Aeneas describes the death of Laocoon. Vergil uses an accumulation of visual and other sensory details to make this scene as vivid as possible. In a short essay, identify some of these details and explain what makes them effective. Be sure to refer specifically to the Latin to support your answer.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 3.A: Develop an interpretation of a Latin text.
